TextEng: "I want to talk to you about your mirror shard."
Text: "당신이 가진 거울 조각 얘기를 하고 싶어요."

TextEng: "I'm ready to play your riddle game for the mirror."
Text: "거울을 걸고 수수께끼 게임을 할 준비가 됐어요."

TextEng: I'll change my answer to a lantern."
"I'll change my answer to a torch."
"I'll change my answer to the sun."
"I'm pretty sure mud is the answer she's looking for."
"Mud? That makes no sense! It isn't bright or burning!"
Text: "진흙이요? 말도 안 돼! 밝지도 타지도 않잖아!"

TextEng: "Enough stupid games. I'll just kill you and take the shard!"
Text: "멍청한 게임은 이제 그만. 그냥 죽이고 조각을 가져갈게!"

TextEng: "But you cheated! None of those riddles make sense!"
Text: "하지만 속였잖아요! 수수께끼가 전부 말이 안 돼!"

TextEng: "I can't let a monster like you live." <StartAction>Attack the medusa.</Start>
Text: "너 같은 괴물을 살려둘 순 없어." <StartAction>메두사를 공격한다.</Start>

TextEng: "Is there anything I can do to help?"
"Maybe you should give the mirror shard to me."
"This is stupid. I don't have time for this."
<StartAction>Intimidate</Start> "Give me the mirror, or I'll end your miserable existence!"
Text: <StartAction>[위협]</Start> "거울 내놔, 안 그러면 네 비참한 목숨 끝장내 주지!"

TextEng: <StartAction>Persuade</Start> "You don't need a constant reminder of what you've become. You should really give the mirror up."
Text: <StartAction>[설득]</Start> "자신이 뭐가 됐는지 계속 상기할 필요 없잖아. 정말 거울은 포기해야 해."

TextEng: "Riddles? Please, anything but that. I HATE riddles!"
Text: "수수께끼요? 제발, 그것만은 안 돼요. 수수께끼 진짜 싫단 말이에요!"

TextEng: "I want to ask you some questions."
"How did a medusa end up as a librarian?"
"I'm looking for pieces of a broken mirror."
